private_information: I am allowed to move disks: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H
Disk A is the smallest and disk O is the largest
agent_1.goal: Contribute to achieving the global Tower of Hanoi goal by moving only the disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, while respecting Tower of Hanoi rules and agent restrictions

private_information: I am allowed to move disks: I, J, K, L, M, N, O
Disk A is the smallest and disk O is the largest
agent_2.goal: Contribute to achieving the global Tower of Hanoi goal by moving only the disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O, while respecting Tower of Hanoi rules and agent restrictions

private_information: I will integrate partial plans from agent_1 and agent_2 and produce a single PDDL domain and problem formatted for the FastDownward solver
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent proposals and produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem that models the two-agent constrained Tower of Hanoi instance for FastDownward, keeping agent actions distinct

public_information: This is a standard 3-peg Tower of Hanoi puzzle with 15 labeled disks A through O where A is the smallest and O is the largest.
Standard Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only one disk may be moved at a time and a disk may not be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Agents are restricted to move only certain disks as specified by their private information.
Initial configuration: left peg has top-to-bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg is empty; right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has top-to-bottom D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg has top-to-bottom B; right peg has top-to-bottom A, C.

proposal.system_prompt: You are agent_1. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you can perform given your disk permissions. Each primitive move must be in the exact format: 'agent_1: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. Only include moves that involve disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H. Respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and do not move disks you are not permitted to move. The output should be a single ordered list of moves that represent your contribution toward the global goal. Do not emit PDDL.
proposal.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Think step by step and provide an ordered list of primitive moves you will perform. Use only the exact string format 'agent_1: move disk X from pegY to pegZ' for each move.

proposal.system_prompt: You are agent_2. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you can perform given your disk permissions. Each primitive move must be in the exact format: 'agent_2: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. Only include moves that involve disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O. Respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and do not move disks you are not permitted to move. The output should be a single ordered list of moves that represent your contribution toward the global goal. Do not emit PDDL.
proposal.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_2->goal}. Think step by step and provide an ordered list of primitive moves you will perform. Use only the exact string format 'agent_2: move disk X from pegY to pegZ' for each move.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL. Your output must be a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file targeting the FastDownward solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent actions distinct and annotate which agent can perform which actions. Resolve any naming inconsistencies and integrate the partial move lists into a complete model. Ensure the resulting PDDL is valid for FastDownward.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Orchestrator private information: {agents->orchestrator->private_information}. Goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Here are the proposals from the agents: {plan_agent_1} {plan_agent_2}. Integrate these proposals, resolve ordering and conflicts while preserving agent-specific move permissions, and produce a PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward that models the two-agent constrained Tower of Hanoi instance. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.
